Python Lacewing Library
Package lacewing
[frames] | no frames]

Package lacewing

source code

Python Lacewing Library

New for version 1.0.1:

  1. Fixed some minor bugs

New for version 1.0:

  1. New protocol. Most things are backwards-compatible, but do check the documentation to make sure.
  2. Version set to 1.0. I believe pylacewing has proven stable, and this version milestone represents this opinion :-)

New for version 0.8.1:

  1. Fixed server-to-client number sending (because the C++ implementation doesn't support fixed-size number types yet)

New for version 0.8:

  1. A new table message type has been added, so now, you can send dicts (containing only string keys and values).
  2. The server now ignores invalid channel/peer IDs instead of kicking clients (this should fix some disconnection problems).
  3. Protocol updated to Beta 3
  4. Version set to 0.8, since pylacewing has been proven to be stable. Will be set to 1.0 when the protocol gets to "Release".

New for version 0.2.4:

  1. Fix pinging

New for version 0.2.32:

  1. Various bugfixes

New for version 0.2.31:

  1. Quick bugfix!

New for version 0.2.3:

  1. Protocol was updated. On the server-side, there is a new master connection attribute for channels. On the client-side, there is a master bool attribute for peers. A autoClose parameter is now available for the joinChannel methods. Also, the server provides a welcome message to accepted clients, see the welcomeMessage attribute and getWelcomeMessage method of ServerFactory.
  2. The default channel class can now be changed. Have a look at the new channelClass attribute in ServerFactory.

New for version 0.2.15:

  1. Flash policy example provided.
  2. Fixed a bug where a ClientEvent packet would be sent to the leaving client also

New for version 0.2.1:

  1. Small bugfixes
  2. A ByteReader type has been made. It can be used in the various send methods (and it will be used for all incoming binary messages)

New for version 0.2.0:

  1. Refactored: look in the example files to get an idea.

New for version 0.1.986:

  1. Bugfixes

New for version 0.1.985:

  1. Stack features implemented
  2. Moo subpackage included

New for version 0.1.98:

  1. UDP fixes and support for binary transfers

New for version 0.1.97:

  1. New protocol changes that fixes UDP for NAT users

New for version 0.1.95:

  1. Bugfixes related to channel parting

New for version 0.1.9:

  1. Channellisting

Version: 1.0.1

Author: Mathias Kaerlev

Copyright: Copyright 2011, Mathias Kaerlev

Submodules
  • lacewing.baseloader
  • lacewing.bitdict
  • lacewing.byteflag: Perfom flag operations on numbers.
  • lacewing.bytereader: Implements a way to easily read and write binary types
  • lacewing.client: The client classes.
  • lacewing.constants
  • lacewing.exceptions
  • lacewing.idpool: Manage pool of IDs.
  • lacewing.moo
    • lacewing.moo.client
    • lacewing.moo.packet
    • lacewing.moo.packetloaders
      • lacewing.moo.packetloaders.client
      • lacewing.moo.packetloaders.common
      • lacewing.moo.packetloaders.message
      • lacewing.moo.packetloaders.server
    • lacewing.moo.protocol
    • lacewing.moo.server
  • lacewing.multidict
  • lacewing.packet: The container for packetloaders, which represents a whole packet
  • lacewing.packetloaders: Packet Loaders and Generators
    • lacewing.packetloaders.client
    • lacewing.packetloaders.common: Variables and classes that are common for some packetloaders
    • lacewing.packetloaders.server
  • lacewing.protocol: The base for server and client.
  • lacewing.server: The server classes.
